page.title: 01Fenlands beyond Dunston
page.content: The fens are of flat, rich soil which is heavily cultivated. The main crops are potatoes sugar beet, and grain. The land is drained into dykes and delphs which feed into the River Witham. Some livestock, mainly sheep, are kept on the banks of Nocton Delph. The land is very sparcely populated, the number of homes is only in single figures. As most people prefer to live in nearby villages. The Section nearest to Dunston village is some woodland known as Nocton Wood., The mature trees are harvested and then the section is replanted. Although a very flat landscape is has its own particular beauty. Varying greatly with the seasons with a good variety of wildlife, including grouse and pheasants.
